image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from Rhode Island; born in Westerly, R.I., May 1, 1812; attended Plainfield (Conn.) Academy, and was graduated from Brown University, Providence, R.I., in 1833; later pursued the study of law at the Cambridge (Mass.) and New Haven (Conn.) Law Schools; was admitted to the bar in 1837 and commenced practice in Westerly, R.I.; also engaged in banking; member of the State house of representatives 1841-1849, 1851-1854, 1858-1862, and 1871-1877; appointed a member of the Governor's council in 1842; elected as a Whig to the Thirty-first Congress (March 4, 1849-March 3, 1851); was not a candidate for renomination in 1850; elected as a Republican to the Thirty-eighth and to the three succeeding Congresses (March 4, 1863-March 3, 1871); chairman, Committee on Commerce (Forty-first Congress); declined to be a candidate for reelection in 1870; delegate to the Union National Convention at Philadelphia in 1866; resumed the practice of law and banking; died in Westerly, Washington County, R.I., April 11, 1881; interment in River Bend Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: In the Palmer-Loper Family Papers, 1667-1994, 13.6 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include Nathan Fellows Dixon. A finding aid is available in the library.

researchRecord.name: In Nathan F. Dixon Family Papers, 1763-1907, 1 container.
researchRecord.description: Copies of legal documents covering land and business transactions, visiting cards, manuscripts of Nathan Dixon and William Dixon, and other papers relating to the Dixon family of Westerly, R.I.

researchRecord.name: In the DeWolf Family Papers, 1790-1845, 2.5 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include Nathan Fellows Dixon. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.

researchRecord.name: In the Charles Lanman Collection, 1841-1866, 0.25 cubic foot.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include Nathan Fellows Dixon. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.
